Comments_List: Object-Oriented programming!
Introduced to C++ and OOP patterns in general. Helped me to learn templating to make code more portable.
the overall knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming, especially C++.
I learnt how to implement programs using C++ and learnt how to elegantly design classes and methods using template and polymorphism.

The course did a great job of covering a good breadth of knowledge about programming but also making sure enough depth was covered as well. As a result, my programming skills drastically increased after taking this course.
C++ knowledge like STL, inheritance, dynamic binding and design pattern.
OOP, C++
I learned C++ programming and object-oriented programming in one class! I love this course. I can feel my programming skills improved.
The basic ideas and skills in c++ programming and some classic methods on object-oriented programming
The course provided a very thorough introduction to OOP and related design patterns. I'm now more comfortable programming in C++ and better understand where to use which design patterns.
Programming in C++, object oriented design.
Object-oriented programming skills.
oop method and implementation
A deep understanding about C++ and the implementation of it.
object oriented design and programming skills

This course is pretty informative! It would be better if there exist some lecture notes about concepts that would help us do the review after class and before exams. Also, for assignments, I would prefer clearer description and requirements, and for test cases, instead of letting us trying to imagine all kinds of possible situation by ourselves, it would be better if it is clear what input will get what kinds of output. Another possibility would be, we could get an executable file about the sample game we are supposed to write. With this sample executable, we could play around and understand what we should get for certain inputs.

The course gives a good overview of OOP although the second half was a bit scattered as we went into design patterns that included implementations in other languages. Getting feedback sooner in grading assignments would have been helpful.

the course covers all important knowledge about c++, which indeed helps me acquire a clear and deep understanding about it.
weaknesses: none.

The strength is the instructor program on live so we can understand the code line by line and the instructor is good at drawing pictures and graph to help us understand. The content is very useful to improve our technical skills.
This was a great course. The pace was ideal, and I think the content was pretty good as well. The assignments did a great job of solidifying material covered in class.
I think the course covers a lot about c++ and that's great. However, I think it is better to use slides.

Strength: I love Prof. Glenn's way of teaching this course. He is terrific! Making everything clear and interesting. This course is beyond my expectation because of him.

Weakness: It is a bit challenging for non-CS majored students. I have to pick up lots of concepts mentioned in class and because there is no handout of this course, I did find it hard to follow especially at the beginning of this course.
Teacher always teaches teaches new things through coding in class, which is pretty cool !

Strengths: The course assumes almost no pre-requisites on the part of the students. And by the end of the class a student would certainly become proficient with C++ and OOP concepts. The instructor did an excellent job with the course: he gave excellent examples, taugh concepts not just theoretically but by illustrating them in class by programming. The programming assignments were very well designed and increased in difficulty gradually.

Weaknesses: more timely grading of assignments would be very useful for us students. But at the same time I do understand that it isn't an easy task to prepare ~100 testcases per assignment.
If slides are provided, this course would be better.

This course introduced c++ in detail. The workload is appropriate. However, sometimes the requirement of homework and how it is graded is not clear. So it's very likely that you finished the homework before the deadline and after several days the requirement changed.
Yes. Take this course and be better at C++ and object oriented programming!
Yes, it is not a very programming intensive course, but you will learn important programming concepts.
If they want to learn c++, this course is definitely an excellent choice!
Yes. Because this course can help a CS student to become a master in C++.
I would definitely recommend this course. I learned a lot and really enjoyed the course. The professor is amazing and the content was pretty interesting.
I would recommend this course to another student because the knowledge learned from this course is very useful and the course is very interesting.
I would strongly recommend this course to other students. This is one of the best courses I took at Yale.
yes! this is a class that can improve their skills on programming significantly
I would recommend this course to any student who is interested to become proficient with C++ and OOP ideas. The course workload is very manageable too.
yes
Great course for learning C++ and improving programming skills. 10/10 recommend.
Yeah. The idea of OOP is super useful.
strongly recommend

It has both pros and cons. So if you do not care about changing your implementation again and again and have to take all the corner cases into consideration and don't mind the late reply of email, take it.
Good course.
